extracted_resume.name: Smit Shah

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Computer Engineering

details: Spearheading the development of an AI-based interview assessment system with modules for resume parsing, adaptive question generation, and multi-modal evaluation.
Engineering a speech analysis module to evaluate fluency, pacing, filler words, and tone using openSMILE and custom signal processing.
Optimizing the system for mixed-language Indian speakers to enhance accuracy and deliver personalized feedback.
Project is ongoing under a freelance contract with a total value of Rs. 50,000.
Conducted an online session on the fundamentals of Machine Learning, teaching core concepts and practical applications to a diverse audience.

certifications: Introduction to TensorFlow for AI, ML and DL – DeepLearning.AI

projects.title: ChatGPT 2 (124M)
details: Trained and implemented from scratch in Pytorch | Python, PyTorch, AWS
Winner of Bhashathon 2025, won a cash prize of Rs. 50,000.
Developed a multilingual next-token prediction model for six Indian languages.
Implemented and trained a GPT-2 model (124M parameters) from scratch in PyTorch.
Trained a SentencePiece unigram tokenizer (vocab size: 50,304) optimized for Indic languages and low-memory systems using reservoir sampling and chunk-based streaming.
Implemented end-to-end data preprocessing pipeline with parallelized processing, deduplication, and language-specific normalization across a 73 GB dataset (3.2B tokens).
Achieved a token generation speed of 56K tokens/sec on an AWS G5, NVIDIA A10G GPU; processed 4.1B tokens using gradient accumulation to manage memory constraints.

projects.title: Chatbot for Power Substation Queries
details: Finalist in Smart India Hackathon 2023 for the project; selected among top 7 out of 139 submissions for the Grand Finale.

projects.title: Fine-tuning microsoft/florence using Transformers and PyTorch
details: Secured rank 972 out of 74,000 participants in the Amazon ML Challenge 2024.

projects.title: Neural Network from Scratch
details: Built a Neural Network from Scratch in core Python without ML using any libraries.

projects.title: A.idea – Where Innovation Meets AI
details: 2nd Place (Rs. 2,000) in poster-making competition hosted by CSI DDU.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning? Can you provide an example of each?
interview_questions.hint: Focus on basic definitions and common algorithms.

interview_questions.question: Can you explain what overfitting is in the context of machine learning and suggest two methods to prevent it?
interview_questions.hint: Think about regularization techniques and data splitting.

interview_questions.question: Write a Python function to calculate the mean and median of a list of numbers. What is the significance of these statistics?
interview_questions.hint: Consider edge cases like empty lists.

interview_questions.question: Explain the intuition behind the gradient descent algorithm. How does it apply to training machine learning models?
interview_questions.hint: Discuss the concept of minimizing a loss function.

interview_questions.question: How would you implement a decision tree classifier from scratch? What key components would you need to consider?
interview_questions.hint: Review splitting criteria and stopping conditions.

interview_questions.question: What are SQL window functions? Can you give an example of a use case where they might be beneficial?
Describe a group project where you had to work with team members from diverse backgrounds. How did you ensure effective collaboration?
interview_questions.hint: Use the STAR method to structure your response.

interview_questions.question: Tell me about a time you faced a significant challenge while working on a project. What strategies did you use to overcome it?
Given your experience in developing AI-based systems, how would you assess the effectiveness of an AI model in real-time applications?
interview_questions.hint: Consider metrics like accuracy, latency, and user feedback.

interview_questions.question: What techniques would you apply to ensure a high-quality multi-modal evaluation system for assessing interview candidates?
interview_questions.hint: Think about integrating different data types like audio, text, and video.

interview_questions.question: In your project 'ChatGPT 2 (124M)', how did you handle data preprocessing for your large dataset? What challenges did you face?
interview_questions.hint: Expect comments on parallel processing and normalization.

interview_questions.question: Your role as an AI Engineer involves an interview assessment system. What specific methods did you use for resume parsing?
interview_questions.hint: Mention techniques like keyword extraction or NLP.

interview_questions.question: You participated in the Smart India Hackathon with your chatbot project. What was the primary function of your chatbot?
interview_questions.hint: Focus on the problem it was designed to solve.

interview_questions.question: You have a certification in Advanced Learning Algorithms. Can you explain the significance of algorithms in machine learning over raw data?
interview_questions.hint: Discuss model performance improvement and interpretability.

interview_questions.question: Define what a confusion matrix is and explain its components. How can it help in evaluating a classification model?
interview_questions.hint: Ensure to mention true positives, false positives, etc.

interview_questions.question: What are some common metrics used to evaluate regression models? Can you explain at least two?
interview_questions.hint: Discuss metrics like RMSE and R-squared.
